pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:6.2: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was constantly socializing with a lay person and his child.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.3: “How can Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī constantly socialize with a lay person and his son?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.7: How can the nun Caṇḍakāḷī constantly socialize with a lay person and his son?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:8.1: ‘If a nun is constantly socializing with a lay person or a lay person’s son, the nuns should correct her in this way:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:8.2: “Venerable, don’t constantly socialize with a lay person and a lay person’s son. Be secluded, Venerable. The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:8.4: If that nun still continue as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:8.5: If she then stops, all is well. If not, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:10.2: she constantly socializes with improper bodily and verbal actions.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:12.2: whoever is a son or a brother.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:13.2: the nun who is constantly socializing.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.2: Other nuns, those who see it or hear about it. They should say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.4: “Venerable, don’t constantly socialize with lay people and lay people’ sons.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.6: The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.7: And they should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.9: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.10: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.11: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.12: That nun, even if she has to be dragged into the middle of the Order, should be spoken to thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.13: “Venerable, don’t constantly socialize with lay people and lay people’ sons.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.15: The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.16: They should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.18: If she stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.19: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.21: “And, monks, she should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:14.22: A competent and capable nun should inform the Order:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:15.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:15.2: This nun so-and-so is constantly socializing with a lay person and a lay person’s son.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:15.3: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:15.4: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should press her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.1: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.2: This nun so-and-so is constantly socializing with a lay person and a lay person’s son.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.3: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.4: The Order presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.5: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:16.6: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:17.1: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:17.2: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:18.1: This nun so-and-so has been pressed by the Order to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:18.2: The Order approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:19.1: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:19.2: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:19.3: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:20.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:20.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:20.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:21.1: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:21.2: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:21.3: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:22.2: if she is the first offender.
